net.proteusframework.core.metric

Class DpiDeviceMetric

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.metric.DeviceMetric
      • net.proteusframework.core.metric.DpiDeviceMetric
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MonitorDeviceMetric

    public abstract class DpiDeviceMetric
extends DeviceMetric
    The DpiDeviceMetric can handle most conversions using a DPI (Dots Per Inch) value. The DPI for the width and height can be specified separately. The getNativeSize() is left undefined for this class.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com), Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DpiDeviceMetric(double dpi)
      Construct a new DpiDeviceMetric with the given DPI for both the width and height.
      DpiDeviceMetric(double dpiWidth, double dpiHeight)
      Construct a new DpiDeviceMetric with the given DPI values for the width and height.

        Construct a new DpiDeviceMetric with the given DPI for both the width and height.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if dpi<=0

      • DpiDeviceMetric

        public DpiDeviceMetric(double dpiWidth,
                       double dpiHeight)
        Construct a new DpiDeviceMetric with the given DPI values for the width and height.
        Parameters:
        dpiWidth - The DPI for the width
        dpiHeight - The DPI for the height
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either DPI<=0

      • milliMetricHeight

        public MilliMetric milliMetricHeight(Metric metric)
        Description copied from class: DeviceMetric
        Convert the given Metric to a MilliMetric object. PercentMetric objects will be relative to the device size. The given metric is assumed to be a height.
        Specified by:
        milliMetricHeight in class DeviceMetric
        Parameters:
        metric - The Metric to convert
        Returns:
        The MilliMetric equivalent
